name: Denali
hint: Highest peak in North America, in Alaska, formerly called Mount McKinley

name: Mount Logan
hint: Highest mountain in Canada, in the Yukon's Saint Elias Mountains

name: Mount Rainier
hint: Iconic volcanic peak near Seattle, Washington, covered in glaciers

name: Pikes Peak
hint: Famous Colorado summit that inspired 'America the Beautiful'

name: Mount Whitney
hint: Highest peak in the contiguous United States, in California's Sierra Nevada

name: Mount Elbert
hint: Highest peak in the Rocky Mountains, in Colorado

name: Grand Teton
hint: Highest peak of the Teton Range in Wyoming

name: Mount Mitchell
hint: Highest peak east of the Mississippi River, in North Carolina

name: Mauna Kea
hint: Tallest mountain from base to peak on Earth, a dormant volcano in Hawaii

name: Mount St. Helens
hint: Volcano in Washington state that erupted catastrophically in 1980

name: Pico de Orizaba
hint: Highest mountain in Mexico and third-highest in North America, a dormant volcano

name: Popocatepetl
hint: Active volcano near Mexico City, its name means 'Smoking Mountain' in Nahuatl

name: Mount Hood
hint: Oregon's highest peak, a potentially active stratovolcano in the Cascade Range

name: Mount Washington
hint: Highest peak in the northeastern US, once held the world record for wind speed

name: Mauna Loa
hint: World's largest active volcano by mass, on the Big Island of Hawaii

name: Mount Shasta
hint: Prominent stratovolcano in northern California, a spiritual mountain for many cultures

name: Iztaccihuatl
hint: Third-highest peak in Mexico, called the White Woman next to Popocatepetl

name: Mount Robson
hint: Highest peak in the Canadian Rockies, in British Columbia on the Alberta border

name: Sierra Madre Occidental
hint: Major mountain range along western Mexico, home to the Copper Canyon

name: Longs Peak
hint: Iconic fourteener in Rocky Mountain National Park, Colorado with a flat summit

name: Mount Katahdin
hint: Highest peak in Maine, northern terminus of the Appalachian Trail

name: Volcan Tajumulco
hint: Highest peak in Central America, a stratovolcano in western Guatemala

name: Mount Foraker
hint: Third-highest peak in the US, neighbor to Denali in the Alaska Range

name: Mount Kilauea
hint: One of the most active volcanoes on Earth, on Hawaii's Big Island

name: Cascade Range
hint: Major volcanic mountain range stretching from British Columbia to California
